englishMeaning: to leave something behind or give up
exampleSentence: She had to abandon her car during the storm.
usageHint: Used when someone gives up on something or someone.

englishMeaning: the power or skill to do something
exampleSentence: He has the ability to solve complex problems.
usageHint: Used to describe someone’s skill or competence.

englishMeaning: to take in or soak up
exampleSentence: The sponge can absorb a lot of water.
usageHint: Used literally for liquids or figuratively for information.

englishMeaning: existing in thought or idea but not having a physical form
exampleSentence: He prefers abstract art over realistic paintings.
usageHint: Used to describe ideas or art that are not concrete.

englishMeaning: existing in large quantities
exampleSentence: The farm produced abundant crops this year.
usageHint: Used to describe something in plentiful supply.

englishMeaning: to agree to receive or undertake something offered
exampleSentence: She accepted the invitation to the party.
usageHint: Used for agreeing or receiving something.

englishMeaning: the ability or right to enter or use something
exampleSentence: Students have access to the library after school.
usageHint: Used to describe the right or means to reach something.

englishMeaning: an unexpected event causing harm or damage
exampleSentence: He broke his arm in a car accident.
usageHint: Used for unplanned harmful events.

englishMeaning: to go somewhere with someone
exampleSentence: She accompanied her friend to the hospital.
usageHint: Used when one person goes along with another.

englishMeaning: free from errors, precise
exampleSentence: The scientist provided accurate measurements.
usageHint: Used to describe correctness or precision.

englishMeaning: to successfully reach a goal or complete something
exampleSentence: She achieved her dream of becoming a doctor.
usageHint: Used when someone successfully completes a task or goal.

englishMeaning: to accept or admit the truth or existence of something
exampleSentence: He acknowledged his mistake in the report.
usageHint: Used when someone admits or accepts something.

englishMeaning: to adjust to new conditions
exampleSentence: Animals adapt to changes in their environment.
usageHint: Used when someone or something changes to fit new conditions.

englishMeaning: a person who is dependent on a substance or activity
exampleSentence: He is a video game addict.
usageHint: Used to describe someone who cannot stop a habit.

englishMeaning: to change something slightly to make it better
exampleSentence: She adjusted the mirror to see properly.
usageHint: Used when altering something to improve it.

englishMeaning: to regard with respect or warm approval
exampleSentence: I admire her courage and determination.
usageHint: Used to show respect or approval for someone or something.

englishMeaning: to confess or accept something
exampleSentence: He admitted that he had made a mistake.
usageHint: Used when confessing or agreeing with something.

englishMeaning: to move forward or make progress
exampleSentence: Technology continues to advance rapidly.
usageHint: Used to describe progress or forward movement.

englishMeaning: an unusual or exciting experience
exampleSentence: They went on an adventure through the forest.
usageHint: Used for exciting or unusual experiences.

englishMeaning: guidance or recommendations offered to someone
exampleSentence: She gave me some useful advice about studying.
usageHint: Used when giving guidance or suggestions.

englishMeaning: to have an influence on something
exampleSentence: The weather can affect our mood.
usageHint: Used to describe something causing a change or impact.

englishMeaning: to have enough money or resources to do something
exampleSentence: I cannot afford a new car right now.
usageHint: Used when talking about financial capability or resources.

englishMeaning: to have the same opinion or consent
exampleSentence: We agreed on the plan for the trip.
usageHint: Used to express agreement or consent.

englishMeaning: quick to notice and respond to danger or problems
exampleSentence: The guard remained alert throughout the night.
usageHint: Used to describe someone attentive or watchful.

englishMeaning: to give permission for something
exampleSentence: The teacher allowed us to leave early.
usageHint: Used when granting permission.

englishMeaning: to surprise or fill with wonder
exampleSentence: The magician’s tricks amazed the children.
usageHint: Used when something causes surprise or wonder.

englishMeaning: a strong desire to achieve something
exampleSentence: Her ambition is to become a successful lawyer.
usageHint: Used to describe a person’s strong goal or dream.

englishMeaning: a quantity of something
exampleSentence: The total amount of water used was high.
usageHint: Used to describe the size or quantity of something.

englishMeaning: to examine in detail for understanding
exampleSentence: Scientists analyze data to find patterns.
usageHint: Used when studying or examining something closely.

englishMeaning: belonging to the very distant past
exampleSentence: The museum has many ancient artifacts.
usageHint: Used to describe things from a long time ago.

englishMeaning: a strong feeling of displeasure or rage
exampleSentence: His anger was obvious when he saw the mistake.
usageHint: Used to describe strong feelings of displeasure.

englishMeaning: to make something known publicly
exampleSentence: The company announced a new product today.
usageHint: Used to inform people officially or publicly.

englishMeaning: happening once every year
exampleSentence: The school holds an annual sports day.
usageHint: Used to describe events or occurrences every year.

englishMeaning: a response to a question or problem
exampleSentence: She gave the correct answer to the question.
usageHint: Used for replying or solving a problem.

englishMeaning: a feeling of worry or nervousness
exampleSentence: He felt anxiety before his exams.
usageHint: Used to describe nervous or worried feelings.

englishMeaning: to express regret for something done wrong
exampleSentence: She apologized for arriving late.
usageHint: Used to express regret for a mistake.

englishMeaning: to come into view or be seen
exampleSentence: A rainbow appeared after the rain.
usageHint: Used when something becomes visible or noticeable.

englishMeaning: to make a formal request or use something
exampleSentence: He applied for a scholarship at the university.
usageHint: Used for submitting requests or using knowledge/tools.

englishMeaning: to assign a job or role to someone
exampleSentence: They appointed her as the new manager.
usageHint: Used to give someone a position or responsibility.

englishMeaning: to recognize the value of something
exampleSentence: I appreciate your help with the project.
usageHint: Used to express gratitude or recognition.

englishMeaning: to come near or move toward something
exampleSentence: The train approached the station slowly.
usageHint: Used when moving closer to a person, place, or goal.

englishMeaning: to officially agree with or accept
exampleSentence: The committee approved the new plan.
usageHint: Used when giving formal agreement or permission.

englishMeaning: to give reasons for or against something
exampleSentence: They argued about which movie to watch.
usageHint: Used for discussion with reasons or disagreement.
